Options.GROUP[Time2Work.Time2Work.Mod.Wo: Modify the share of evening and night work shifts
Modify the work arrival and departure times
Options.GROUP[Time2Work.Time2Work.Mod.Lu: Modify the probability of workers taking a lunch break
Options.OPTION_DESCRIPTION[Time2Work.Tim: Reset all settings to default values

This factor will adjust the variation in arrival and departure times from work. A higher factor will increase the variation on work arrival and departure - meaning more cims will not arrive to work on time or work for longer hours. A value of zero will disable this feature. Note that the effects of this feature in the morning and evening peak hours is different: in the morning there is an equal probabilty of early or late arrival, however, in the evening the probability of leaving late is higher than of leaving early. This was implemented this way to simulate better the differences of morning and evening commute from the real world.
Probability of workers that will take a lunch break. During a lunch break, workers might go shopping for food or convenience food, or go for leisure. After that they will return to work.
In the Vanilla game, Cims can go for shopping or leisure as early as 4 AM. This option will change that behavior to start around 8 to 10 AM.
Disable vacation and holiday feature and use Vanilla time off system. In the Vanilla game, cims have a 60% probability of taking time off each day.
Options.OPTION[Time2Work.Time2Work.Mod.S: Disable Vacation and Holiday feature for schools
Options.OPTION_DESCRIPTION[Time2Work.Tim: Disable vacation and holiday feature and use Vanilla time off system for schools. In the Vanilla game, cims have a 60% probability of not going to school.
Most countries should have a value between 10 and 15. The default value is reasonable for most countries.
Options.OPTION[Time2Work.Time2Work.Mod.S: Number of vacation days per year
Options.OPTION_DESCRIPTION[Time2Work.Tim: Number of vacation days per year - not including weekends. For countries with a month of vacation, use 22. For the US, a value of 11 is more realistic.
Options.OPTION[Time2Work.Time2Work.Mod.S: Number of vacation days per year
Options.OPTION_DESCRIPTION[Time2Work.Tim: Number of vacation days per year for schools, colleges and universities. Does not include weekends.

This option changes how the simulation works during a day. Average Day corresponds to the Vanilla behavior, which is a combination of weekday and weekend behaviors. With the default vacation/holiday settings (defined in the Shopping and Leisure tab), in an Average Day, around 30% of cims will behave as on the weekend, doing more leisure and shopping activities, while the rest will work or study. The Weekday option will increase work and study activities and lower leisure and shopping. Weekend will do the opposite. On Weekends, schools are closed. The 7 Days Week will rotate through weekdays and weekends, going from Monday to Sunday.
Start time for schools, colleges, and universities.
End time for schools, colleges, and universities.
Start time for work day shift.
End time for work day shift.
